title: IBM hits back at Google's claim of 'quantum supremacy'
text:
IBM has hit back at Google’s claim of being close "quantum supremacy" – the point at which a quantum computer could do calculations that would be impossible to complete by the world’s most powerful supercomputers.

Quantum computers, which have long been hailed as the next big leap for mankind, are incredibly powerful machines that use miniscule quantum particles called qubits to process information.

Unlike a regular computer that relies on a binary system of bits, ones and zeros, to operate, a quantum computer uses “qubits”, which may exist in multiple states of ones and zeros simultaneously.

Researchers at Google claimed to have developed a quantum processor, called Sycamore, that solved a...
description: IBM has hit back at Google’s claim of being close "quantum supremacy" – the point at which a quantum computer could do calculations that would be impossible to complete by the world’s most powerful supercomputers.
